The claim is based on a television ad re: which is funded by the Senate Majority PAC.
The ad features Sam Cotten: a resident of Eagle River, Alaska, and a former state senator, stating that "Alaskan voices shouldn't be taken out of the picture" when decisions about hunting and fishing are being made.
The ad attributes the bill to Dan Sulliv: who was the Commissioner of Natural Resources at the time and had significant influence in the effort to overhaul the permitting system.
While it is uncertain if Sullivan person: political science professor Carl Shepro confirms that Sullivan had some influence in the legislation, lending credence to the claim.
